The claim originated from a report by ne: which was republished by several media outlets including Outlook, Free Press Journal, Dainik Jagran, and Newstrack.
The tweet in question was made by an imp: Sarah Sachin Pilot (@SarahSachin)' on July 12. The account misspelled Sara Pilot's name and had grammatical errors in its bio, indicating that it was not an official account.
Sara Pilot does not have an official Twi: making it unlikely that she tweeted about Ashok Gehlot.
The expert mentions that IANS has a hist: including those of other prominent individuals like Raghuram Rajan and Biplap Deb, raising doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
